I. The daughter with B blood type

J. The child with a rare blood type not listed

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

The I^A and I^B alleles are both dominant toiandcodominantto each other. A woman of blood group O marries a man who has blood group B. There are four children in the family: a son and daughter of blood group O; a daughter who has A blood type; and a son who has B blood type. One of the children is adopted. Which child is the adopted child?

A. the daughter of blood group O

B. The son with A blood type

C. the son of blood group O

D. the daughter who has blood group A
